title: Boop
body:
gif by @jjeongukks

Pairing: Yoongi x reader

Genre: fluff

Wordcount: 455

Requested: @yeontanismypresident

You stumble inside your apartment, the fatigue hitting you hard as soon as you’re in the confines of your home. Your eyelids droop shut and you kick off your shoes, letting your purse drop to the floor. Friday at last.

Without opening your eyes, you shuffle out of the entryway and into the living room only stopping once your knees hit the side of the couch. Then you lean forward, letting yourself fall over the armrest. You expected to land on the worn, leather cushions but instead, your body hits another and you let out a gasp, your eyes flying open to meet another pair, bloodshot and just as wide as yours.

“Yoongi?” you ask putting your hands on either side of his head and pushing yourself off of him.

His own hands have instinctively flown up to your waist and now they dig in. “Well, that was a rude awakening,” he grumbles then gently pushes you back so you can both sit up.

“Were you sleeping?”

He brings his hands up and presses the heels to his eyes. “Yeah, I guess I did. I was waiting for you to get home so we could hang out.”

“I’m sorry I got off so late,” you say. “Someone called in last minute and there was no one else to cover so I had to stay till closing.”

Your boyfriend reaches out to you, wrapping his arms around your shoulders and pulling you back against him with a sleepy groan. “You don’t have to apologize,” he slurs in your ear then nuzzles his nose into the crook of your neck. “You smell like coffee.”

“Sorry.”

Yoongi hums. “No, I like coffee.”

You let out a giggle and place a hand on his chest, pushing him back a few inches so you can look at him. His mouth turns down into a pout and his eyelids droop. “Why don’t we go to bed?” you ask.

“I’m not tired,” Yoongi replies and his eyes fall all the way shut. Right.

With another chuckle, you reach up and press your finger to his nose. At the contact, he scrunches it up and cracks an eye open again to peer at you. “What was that for?”

“Your nose is just so boopable. I couldn’t resist.”

His mouth spreads into a sleepy grin and then with another adorable groan, he drags himself up off the couch, running a hand through his dark, rumpled hair before offering it to you. “Come on, babe,” he says. “Let’s go to bed.”

You look up at him with your own exhausted smile before reaching out to clasp his fingers with yours. Then you let him pull you to your feet and lead you to the bedroom.

title: BTS One Shot || ❄️ 𝓐 𝓒𝓸𝓵𝓭 𝓓𝓪𝔂 𝓣𝓸 𝓚𝓲𝓵𝓵 𝓞𝓾𝓻 𝓛𝓸𝓿𝓮  ❄️ || You x Yoongi
body:
↳ When you spend too much time apart, Yoongi starts questioning your relationship. And comes to the conclusion that it’s time to make some changes … What he did not take into account, however, was your fighting spirit. Because you are not ready to let him take the easy way out just yet … 

〖 Requested 〗

Prompts
81 “It’s cold, you should take my jacket.”
87 “You’re so adorable.”

angst, fluff

Word Count
2.060

❝ What? Did you actually believe I would have just let you go like this?” You recline in his embrace to get a better look at his face. “Well, Min Yoongi, brace yourself. Because I’m not gonna let you fuck this up, you hear me? As long as there’s still some life left in this relationship, I’m gonna fight for us. So, get ready to get bruised.”

“Brave words for a girl that bruises like a peach.”

“I have sensitive skin. So what? Are you implying I’m a weakling?”

Without warning, you jump up to enclose Yoongi’s waist with your legs. He stumbles backwards but manages to keep his balance.

“I would never suggest anything of that sort,” he then smiles. “My little fighter.”

“Little?”

“Did I mention you’re adorable?” Yoongi cooes, a smug smirk lingering on his rosy lips.

“Cut it out!” you warn him. “Or I’m going to punch you – ❞


𝓐 𝓒𝓸𝓵𝓭 𝓓𝓪𝔂 𝓣𝓸 𝓚𝓲𝓵𝓵 𝓞𝓾𝓻 𝓛𝓸𝓿𝓮 


“Jimin, I’m telling you, I have a bad feeling about this,” you mumble into the receiver, your phone wedged between ear and shoulder while your hands are busy sifting through your neatly hung up shirts once more. “I haven’t seen Yoongi in months because he was so busy, and now he suddenly thinks we ‘need to talk’?”

“Y/n,” Jimin sighs on the other end of the line. “I’m sure you have nothing to worry about. Just the other day, Yoongi told me how he longed for your company. You know he’s not the best at texting. I bet he simply wants to use the first chance he gets to see you, now that we’re done recording. Wouldn’t you say it’s a good sign that he chooses to spend his first night off in weeks with you?”

“I hope you’re right.”

But I don’t think you are.

“Anyway, thanks for listening to me whine for forty minutes straight, Jiminie. But I’ve gotta go. He’ll be here to pick me up any minute now.”

“All right. Did you manage to find something nice to wear?”

Frowning, you give your reflection in the mirror a critical once-over.

“Well, since I don’t really know what to expect, I just threw on something casual. So I won’t feel stupid when he, you know, breaks up with me.”

“If he breaks up with you.” Only now that Jimin pointed it out do you become painfully aware of your choice of words. “Which he won’t, obviously. Or he would have talked about it to either Namjoon or me. I think we can both agree that Yoongi is not too big on sharing his feelings, but he surely would never make such a drastic choice without consulting his closest friends first.”

“You don’t know that.” There is an undeniable quiver in your voice which you are sure does not go unnoticed by Jimin.

“You are right, I don’t,” he admits, his voice as tender as his warm Koala hugs. You could really use one of those now. ”But what I do know is that, no matter what, I’ll be here for you. So don’t be too scared, Y/nnie. You’ll get through this.“

"We’ll see …”

You almost jump out of your skin at the sudden sound of the doorbell ringing, announcing Yoongi’s dreaded arrival.

“Was that the door?” Jimin asks.

“Yes. I’ve gotta go.“

With these words, you end the call and grab your purse before running off to answer the door to your small studio apartment.

You were expecting him. Nonetheless, your heart stumbles at the sight of no other than Min Yoongi standing in the dimly lit hallway of your apartment building, eyes lowered to the ground, hands clasped behind his back when you open the door. He looks thin, his cheeks hollow.

"Hey,” he greets you, the reluctant half-smile tugging at the corner of his mouth knocking the air straight out of your lungs.

“H-Hey.”

“We should get going while the weather is still agreeable. The sun’s out, but the forecast predicted rain showers later today.”

Without waiting for your response or reaction, Yoongi turns his back on you and starts making his way down the stairs to the street door. Quickly, you slip into your shoes and follow him, making sure not to run to preserve at least some of your dignity.

Seriously, who does he think he is? Only messaging you one day ahead, letting you know that you have to meet, not even inquiring whether or not the chosen time and place would even be convenient for you. As if you have nothing better to do than sit around and wait for him all day when he rarely ever deemed it necessary to call you – or pick up your calls – these past few months.

“Yoongi, wait!” you call after him, struggling to keep up with his smart pace once you are out in the street, only now realizing that you left your jacket hanging by your door, having been completely thrown off by Yoongi’s baffling behavior.

But he doesn’t even slow down for a second. Both hands buried in his jacket pockets, black hood and baseball cap drawn deep down into his face, concealing it from your view, Yoongi keeps striding on, even mending his pace. Until he stops cold in his step and turns around, so unexpectedly you collide with his toned chest.

“What the hell, Yoongi!?”

"I’m sorry,” he mutters, avoiding your gaze as he gently grabs you by your elbows to hold you at arm’s length.

“I’m sorry. I thought I could do this, but I can’t.”

“Do what, Yoongi? You’re starting to freak me out.”

“I’m sorry.”

“Then stop apologizing and tell me what the hell is going on!”

“I’m – I don’t know. Could we maybe just take a walk for now?”

You know Yoongi well enough to recognize the fear in his eyes. No. Not just fear. Sheer panic.

“Okay,” you nod. “Okay. Let’s walk.“

And so you do. Walk. In perfect silence for minutes on end, side by side, each occupied with your own thoughts as you wander through the empty back streets of Seoul under the setting sun, circling your block a good half a dozen times before Yoongi looks at you for the first time. You feign ignorance, but you can feel his gaze settling on your side profile.

"Y/n. You’re only wearing a sweatshirt,” he suddenly remarks, slowing down.

“It’s cold, you should take my jacket,“ he then states, already taking off his coat.

"And then what?” you scoff, coming to a halt a few feet ahead of him. “Then you’ll be cold. What good will that do? Your voice is worth millions, as I recall it. Do you really think I can afford to get you sick? Besides, I’m fine. And it’s my fault, after all. I left my jacket. I should have been ready when you came to pick me up. And it’s not like this is the first time I’m cold. I can deal. I’m no damsel in distress.“

Your head held up high, you turn back around and continue walking. To your surprise, however, you can hear a low chuckle coming from behind you where Yoongi is still standing, unmoving.

”What?“ you demand to know the cause for his amusement.

"I just forgot how stubborn you are, that’s all,” he grins, his expression strangely affectionate, considering the previous course of this meeting. "You’re so adorable when you get angry.”

“I’m not angry,” you groan.

“Yes, you are. At yourself. For being such a dumbass.”

At this point, he’s just asking for trouble. When you turn back towards him, Yoongi’s eyes are sparkling with mischief, peeking at you out from under the brim of his cap.

“Oh, really?” you wonder, slowly meandering towards him, head tilted to one side, eying him intently. Still smiling, Yoongi mirrors your gesture, licking his lips, getting ready to play. “So, you can see right through me, huh?”

“Yes, I can,” he boldly states, not even hesitating for a second.

“Well, then I’m clearly at a disadvantage here. Because I can’t figure out what the hell is going on here, Yoongi.” Standing in front of him now, you pause, the tension between your bodies palpable, the silence so heavy you could cut it with a knife. “And what the fuck you want from me.”

Suddenly, Yoongi’s glance darkens, a cold shadow falling over his soft features.

“Initially, I came here to –” He can’t seem to bring himself to finish the sentence.

“To break up with me,” you do it for him.

His eyes grow wide with surprise.

“You knew?”

“I had a feeling.”

“I see. That’s something I always admired about you, you know. Your intuition. Your empathy. I think those are fairly attractive qualities.”

“So?”

“So what?” he echoes.

“Why didn’t you? Break up with me? Or – Are you –“

"No,” he shakes his head. “Oh, no. I’m not gonna break up with you, Y/n. Not today, anyway.” He pauses. “Come to think of it, I don’t particularly like today.”

“Yeah, me neither,” you agree, reaching out to take Yoongi’s cold hands into your own, your gaze still locked with his as your heart is overflowing with relief. “I mean, wouldn’t it be a terribly cold day to kill our love? So grey and dreary? Let’s wait till spring, maybe, when it’s warmer, and the cherry trees are in full bloom, and break up then, if you still want to. Until then, let’s agree not to make any rash decisions. Instead, let’s just see how we feel about us then, and keep this up for a little while longer. Because I have a feeling, we’d be fools for giving up now.”

“Yeah, fools, indeed.”

For a few seconds, you merely look at Yoongi, drinking up the familiar sight of his features. His feline eyes with their brown orbs, deep and dark like infinite wells of pain, wisdom, loneliness, and immeasurable beauty; the softly rounded tip of his nose, reddened by the brisk winter breeze; his pink lips, slightly pursed, in their natural state of a pout. All this makes up the man you love. All this, and so much more that will never be perceptible to the untrained eye. But you, you could always see beyond the façade, glimpse the man behind the mask. A man afraid of loss, of rejection and, most of all, of his own shortcomings.

“For now, let’s just be us,” you whisper as you get up on your tiptoes and let go of Yoongi’s hands to cup his cheeks with your palms. “Because, whatever we are, it’s good.”

“Yes,” Yoongi says, slowly nodding his head, his voice low and his gaze so intense, you can feel your soul melting away, running towards him.

“I don’t think I ever told you this.” Now, his arms close around your waist, pulling you to his chest. "But I’ve never felt this safe with anybody else before, Y/n. And it’s scary. Hella scary. And with all the distance, I just – I got in my head. And I know I’m not always easy. And heaven knows I’ve made things harder on us than they should have been. This relationship was work from its very beginning. And I blamed it on my profession. The truth, however, is that I was making excuses. Because I was scared shitless. Afraid of allowing this to grow, of getting hurt. Again. So I wanted to take the easy way out before it would be too late, actually having convinced myself that it would be what’s best for you. But I was wrong. This is great, and you are the best thing that ever happened to me. Well, the best person, anyway. And I don’t want to lose you, Y/n.”

Smiling through tears, you wrap your arms around Yoongi’s neck and draw yourself up to his height.

“Well, I’m glad you came to that conclusion.” You rest your forehead against his. "But what made you think I would have just let your bullshit pass, hmm?”

Your words elicit a stifled laugh from him.

“What? Did you actually believe I would have just let you go like this?” You recline in his embrace to get a better look at his face. “Well, Min Yoongi, brace yourself. Because I’m not gonna let you fuck this up, you hear me? As long as there’s still some life left in this relationship, I’m gonna fight for us. So, get ready to get bruised.”

“Brave words for a girl that bruises like a peach.”

“I have sensitive skin. So what? Are you implying I’m a weakling?”

Without warning, you jump up to enclose Yoongi’s waist with your legs. He stumbles backwards but manages to keep his balance.

“I would never suggest anything of that sort,” he then smiles. “My little fighter.”

“Little?”

“Did I mention you’re adorable?” Yoongi cooes, a smug smirk lingering on his rosy lips.

“Cut it out!” you warn him. “Or I’m going to punch you –”

Slowly, you lower your face towards his. You’re so close now, you can feel Yoongi’s warm breath brushing past your skin.

“– in the mouth with my own mouth, softly. Because I love you. And I’ve been wanting to kiss you for months.”

“So shut up and do it already.”

I know I haven’t posted writing in a while, so I really hope you enjoyed this. 

Much love, Ana 💖

“You are right, I don’t,” he admits, his voice as tender as his warm Koala hugs. You could really use one of those now. ”But what I do know is that, no matter what, I’ll be here for you. So don’t be too scared, Y/nnie. You’ll get through this.“

"We’ll see …”

You almost jump out of your skin at the sudden sound of the doorbell ringing, announcing Yoongi’s dreaded arrival.

“Was that the door?” Jimin asks.

“Yes. I’ve gotta go.“

With these words, you end the call and grab your purse before running off to answer the door to your small studio apartment.

You were expecting him. Nonetheless, your heart stumbles at the sight of no other than Min Yoongi standing in the dimly lit hallway of your apartment building, eyes lowered to the ground, hands clasped behind his back when you open the door. He looks thin, his cheeks hollow.

"Hey,” he greets you, the reluctant half-smile tugging at the corner of his mouth knocking the air straight out of your lungs.

“H-Hey.”

“We should get going while the weather is still agreeable. The sun’s out, but the forecast predicted rain showers later today.”

Without waiting for your response or reaction, Yoongi turns his back on you and starts making his way down the stairs to the street door. Quickly, you slip into your shoes and follow him, making sure not to run to preserve at least some of your dignity.

Seriously, who does he think he is? Only messaging you one day ahead, letting you know that you have to meet, not even inquiring whether or not the chosen time and place would even be convenient for you. As if you have nothing better to do than sit around and wait for him all day when he rarely ever deemed it necessary to call you – or pick up your calls – these past few months.

“Yoongi, wait!” you call after him, struggling to keep up with his smart pace once you are out in the street, only now realizing that you left your jacket hanging by your door, having been completely thrown off by Yoongi’s baffling behavior.

But he doesn’t even slow down for a second. Both hands buried in his jacket pockets, black hood and baseball cap drawn deep down into his face, concealing it from your view, Yoongi keeps striding on, even mending his pace. Until he stops cold in his step and turns around, so unexpectedly you collide with his toned chest.

“What the hell, Yoongi!?”

"I’m sorry,” he mutters, avoiding your gaze as he gently grabs you by your elbows to hold you at arm’s length.

“I’m sorry. I thought I could do this, but I can’t.”

“Do what, Yoongi? You’re starting to freak me out.”

“I’m sorry.”

“Then stop apologizing and tell me what the hell is going on!”

“I’m – I don’t know. Could we maybe just take a walk for now?”

You know Yoongi well enough to recognize the fear in his eyes. No. Not just fear. Sheer panic.

“Okay,” you nod. “Okay. Let’s walk.“

And so you do. Walk. In perfect silence for minutes on end, side by side, each occupied with your own thoughts as you wander through the empty back streets of Seoul under the setting sun, circling your block a good half a dozen times before Yoongi looks at you for the first time. You feign ignorance, but you can feel his gaze settling on your side profile.

"Y/n. You’re only wearing a sweatshirt,” he suddenly remarks, slowing down.

“It’s cold, you should take my jacket,“ he then states, already taking off his coat.

"And then what?” you scoff, coming to a halt a few feet ahead of him. “Then you’ll be cold. What good will that do? Your voice is worth millions, as I recall it. Do you really think I can afford to get you sick? Besides, I’m fine. And it’s my fault, after all. I left my jacket. I should have been ready when you came to pick me up. And it’s not like this is the first time I’m cold. I can deal. I’m no damsel in distress.“

Your head held up high, you turn back around and continue walking. To your surprise, however, you can hear a low chuckle coming from behind you where Yoongi is still standing, unmoving.

”What?“ you demand to know the cause for his amusement.

"I just forgot how stubborn you are, that’s all,” he grins, his expression strangely affectionate, considering the previous course of this meeting. "You’re so adorable when you get angry.”

“I’m not angry,” you groan.

“Yes, you are. At yourself. For being such a dumbass.”

At this point, he’s just asking for trouble. When you turn back towards him, Yoongi’s eyes are sparkling with mischief, peeking at you out from under the brim of his cap.

“Oh, really?” you wonder, slowly meandering towards him, head tilted to one side, eying him intently. Still smiling, Yoongi mirrors your gesture, licking his lips, getting ready to play. “So, you can see right through me, huh?”

“Yes, I can,” he boldly states, not even hesitating for a second.

“Well, then I’m clearly at a disadvantage here. Because I can’t figure out what the hell is going on here, Yoongi.” Standing in front of him now, you pause, the tension between your bodies palpable, the silence so heavy you could cut it with a knife. “And what the fuck you want from me.”

Suddenly, Yoongi’s glance darkens, a cold shadow falling over his soft features.

“Initially, I came here to –” He can’t seem to bring himself to finish the sentence.

“To break up with me,” you do it for him.

His eyes grow wide with surprise.

“You knew?”

“I had a feeling.”

“I see. That’s something I always admired about you, you know. Your intuition. Your empathy. I think those are fairly attractive qualities.”

“So?”

“So what?” he echoes.

“Why didn’t you? Break up with me? Or – Are you –“

"No,” he shakes his head. “Oh, no. I’m not gonna break up with you, Y/n. Not today, anyway.” He pauses. “Come to think of it, I don’t particularly like today.”

“Yeah, me neither,” you agree, reaching out to take Yoongi’s cold hands into your own, your gaze still locked with his as your heart is overflowing with relief. “I mean, wouldn’t it be a terribly cold day to kill our love? So grey and dreary? Let’s wait till spring, maybe, when it’s warmer, and the cherry trees are in full bloom, and break up then, if you still want to. Until then, let’s agree not to make any rash decisions. Instead, let’s just see how we feel about us then, and keep this up for a little while longer. Because I have a feeling, we’d be fools for giving up now.”

“Yeah, fools, indeed.”

For a few seconds, you merely look at Yoongi, drinking up the familiar sight of his features. His feline eyes with their brown orbs, deep and dark like infinite wells of pain, wisdom, loneliness, and immeasurable beauty; the softly rounded tip of his nose, reddened by the brisk winter breeze; his pink lips, slightly pursed, in their natural state of a pout. All this makes up the man you love. All this, and so much more that will never be perceptible to the untrained eye. But you, you could always see beyond the façade, glimpse the man behind the mask. A man afraid of loss, of rejection and, most of all, of his own shortcomings.

“For now, let’s just be us,” you whisper as you get up on your tiptoes and let go of Yoongi’s hands to cup his cheeks with your palms. “Because, whatever we are, it’s good.”

“Yes,” Yoongi says, slowly nodding his head, his voice low and his gaze so intense, you can feel your soul melting away, running towards him.

“I don’t think I ever told you this.” Now, his arms close around your waist, pulling you to his chest. "But I’ve never felt this safe with anybody else before, Y/n. And it’s scary. Hella scary. And with all the distance, I just – I got in my head. And I know I’m not always easy. And heaven knows I’ve made things harder on us than they should have been. This relationship was work from its very beginning. And I blamed it on my profession. The truth, however, is that I was making excuses. Because I was scared shitless. Afraid of allowing this to grow, of getting hurt. Again. So I wanted to take the easy way out before it would be too late, actually having convinced myself that it would be what’s best for you. But I was wrong. This is great, and you are the best thing that ever happened to me. Well, the best person, anyway. And I don’t want to lose you, Y/n.”

Smiling through tears, you wrap your arms around Yoongi’s neck and draw yourself up to his height.

“Well, I’m glad you came to that conclusion.” You rest your forehead against his. "But what made you think I would have just let your bullshit pass, hmm?”

Your words elicit a stifled laugh from him.

“What? Did you actually believe I would have just let you go like this?” You recline in his embrace to get a better look at his face. “Well, Min Yoongi, brace yourself. Because I’m not gonna let you fuck this up, you hear me? As long as there’s still some life left in this relationship, I’m gonna fight for us. So, get ready to get bruised.”

“Brave words for a girl that bruises like a peach.”

“I have sensitive skin. So what? Are you implying I’m a weakling?”

Without warning, you jump up to enclose Yoongi’s waist with your legs. He stumbles backwards but manages to keep his balance.

“I would never suggest anything of that sort,” he then smiles. “My little fighter.”

“Little?”

“Did I mention you’re adorable?” Yoongi cooes, a smug smirk lingering on his rosy lips.

“Cut it out!” you warn him. “Or I’m going to punch you –”

Slowly, you lower your face towards his. You’re so close now, you can feel Yoongi’s warm breath brushing past your skin.

“– in the mouth with my own mouth, softly. Because I love you. And I’ve been wanting to kiss you for months.”

“So shut up and do it already.”

I know I haven’t posted writing in a while, so I really hope you enjoyed this. 

Much love, Ana 💖

Yoongi:...
body:
Yoongi: “Here’s your coffee, brat.”

Jungkook: “Is it poisoned?”

Yoongi: “What?”

Jungkook: “I asked if it’s poisoned?”

Yoongi: “I… Don’t know?? Why would it be poisoned?”

Jungkook: “Did you get the coffee from the blue or red box?”

Yoongi: “Blue?”

Jungkook: [chugs down coffee]

Yoongi: “WAIT, JUNGKOOK, WHICH ONE IS THE POISONED ONE????”

hey i don’t actually know what I’m doing...

Masterlist

title: Idols Dream: Chapter Nine
body:
☁️ au: idol!au

☁️ chapter word count: 2.7k

☁️ chapter summary: You and Kris figure out how to start your career and Jackson tells you a his huge secret.

   ↪ A/N: I tried making this one a little longer! Hope you like it ^^

✎ masterlist

It didn’t take long until I was fully settled into my new apartment. My parents were able to send most of my belongings within a few days and thanks to Jackson who helped me lift all my boxes of clothes and my computer etc. the move went really fast.

“You know I’m going to have to ask you to pay rent soon since you basically live here” I say as I plop myself onto the kitchen isle.

“Yea and you know I basically pay rent since I buy and cook food for you” Jackson says as he opens the fridge and grabs a few eggs.

“Fine…” I say as I rip open a pack of cookies he just bought. “Don’t take this the wrong way, cause I love having you over, but why do you hang out here so much?” I quickly continue to make sure I don’t offend him, “I mean I’m sure your apartment is a lot nicer than this one…”

He tilts his head and stays quiet for a while. Silence between us isn’t awkward, it’s actually never been awkward either. Since we’ve been hanging out almost constantly for the past few days he feels like an old friend.

“I’m just happy to not be alone” he finally says as he puts a fried egg on top of the beautifully made bibimbap that he whipped up on my request. “my apartment is a lot nicer than yours,” he smirks as he hands me the bowl, “but it also gets really lonely.”

“Why don’t you have people over then?” 

“Cause the small amount of friends I do have are either not in Shanghai, way too busy or both” He says as he starts to dig in, “And I’m trying to hang out with you as much as possible before that happens to you aswell. Now eat”

I don’t really know what to say, so I just stuff my face instead. Halfway through our meal my phone starts to ring, it’s Kris.

“Hey” I pick up.

“Hey, can you come to the studio today? Me and Louis have been brainstorming all week and we think we know how to get your name out there” He says exitedly.

“Umm, wow ok yea totally, you mean today as in now?” I answer looking at Jackson for approval. It feels a little weird to just leave after he basically told me all his friends except me are super busy all the time. 

He smiles warmly and nods, “Go”.

“Yea as soon as possible!” I hear Louis say in the backgroud.

“Ok I’m on my way!” I shove the last bit of food in my mouth and run around gathering my keys, wallet and headphones. I stumble and fall as I put my shoes on and Jackson just laughs at me, still eating in peace.

“Wish me luck! Don’t forget to lock the door when you leave!” I remind Jackson and close the door behind me.

Arriving at the building where the studio is located I see the same receptionist who was a bitch to me and Jess when we were here last. Reluctantly I walk up to the desk, not looking forward to her attitude and definitaly not her ruining a most likely very special day. 

“The 41 floo-” I get interrupted by her and the two other receptionist standing up and bowing. “floor…?”

“Good afternoon miss, the elevator is here in a few seconds” she says politely, her hand gesturing to the elevators as a guard opens the gate.

Her kindness surprises me and all I can respond is a mumbled “T- Thank you” as I move on the the elevators.

Reaching the 41st floor, Kris’ labels offices and studios, I greet the receptionist and walk down the hallway to studio 1, knocking before I enter. Kris and Louis are sitting by the mixing board, their backs facing me, working on some song I’ve never heard before. I guess they didn’t notice me coming in with the loud music playing. I walk up right behind them and watch what they’re doing.

“That’s nice” I say as the music stops.

They both jump off their seats, “What th- You scared the living shit out of me!” Kris says as Louis holds his chest and breathes out.

“I’m sorry but I had to!” I laugh as I replay their terrified faces in my head.

“Anyways…” Kris sits back down, “I’m glad you like it cause it’s for you!” 

“What?”

“Well I thought R&B and jazz would go great with your voice so Louis whipped up some samples.” Kris says as he started to play another song.

The beats are absolutely incredible, super detailed and high quality. The music fills my head and I get the same feeling as the first time I ever sung in this studio. I close my eyes and the humming just escapes me. 

“Record” Kris says quietly as Louis picks his phone up and starts to record.

After 40 seconds or so the sample ends and I snap back to reality.

“I think you just made your first song” Kris chuckles, “That was suprisingly easy… and fast”

Louis just stares at me memerized. “And that just… comes to you? Like naturally?”

“Hmm… It’s more like an urge to let it out. I don’t think about it, I just sing whatever feels good”

Louis nods wide-eyed and turns back to the monitors. “Well we can listen to some more samples and the ones you like we can make into full songs. You write music too?

“Yea” 

“Well damn, then we can get started already tonight, everything we need is in this studio!” Louis claps his hands together in exitement.

“Now for promoting, I have some ideas” Kris says as he pulls me to the large couch on the other side of the room.

“I’m fiming a music video for my new song in two days and I thought maybe you could be in it?”

“Are you serious??” 

“We needed to cast a girl anyways and I thought this would be a great teaser for you. We could keep your identity unknown and have people curious about who you are, then right before we release your song we make sure your face is everywhere so everybody is talking about ‘the mystery girl’ you know?”

“I love that” I say so exited I can’t sit still.

“We’ll also try to get some famous music people in Asia to post your face on their social media” He says as he start to look for something in the pile of papers on the table.

Well I know atleast one person who’d help out with that, I think to myself.

“So these are some concept pictures my director sent me” Kris says as he shows me some printed photos. One picture shows a foggy room lit up with a bunch of purple neon lights on the wall, another a white 1966 mustang convertible on a lavender field, the third picture a pool lit up purple with pink rosepetals and glitter on the surface.

“I’m guessing the theme is purple?” I chuckle, “Are these like photos for inspiration or…”

“No they are all taken from the set” He answers as he shows me even more aesthetic scenery. “These are going to be backgrounds in the video”

I almost choke, and I thought they were photoshopped or taken from Instagram or something.

“Your telling me you’ll be in a lavenderfield in a 1966 mustang” I blink at Kris.

“If you agree you’ll be there too”

“I’m totally down.” I say as I keep looking through the pictures, in awe that some of these places even exist.

Kris and I start talking more in detail about the music video and how they are going to promote me to the world and later all three of us start to work on music. I pick the samples I like the most and as Kris and Louis start to mess around with the beat I write a few test verses.

A few hours pass and we order dinner to eat while we work, same thing when the clock strikes 12 and Louis demands a midnight snack. Time flies by and we’ve somehow managed to lay down the basic structure of three different songs.

“Guys I think it’s time we go home and sleep” Kris yawns.

I look at my phone, 4am… I didn’t really notice how tired I was until Kris started yawning like crazy next to me.

“Yea I could use some sleep…” I yawn back.

“Oh come on guys we just got the flow!” Louis protests, having just as much energy as 12 hours ago. 

“We can continue tomorrow” Kris stands up an grabs his jacket. “(Y/N) you need a ride?”

My apartment is actually a 20 minute walk away, like Kevin said it has a crazy convenient location, but I’m not sure I want to walk 20 minutes alone at 4am in the morning.

“Yes please” I stand up as well to get my things.

Louis throws a little hissyfit about us ruining “the flow” but soon gives up and follow us out and down to the garage. I’m not surprised to see a bunch of fancy and expensive cars when the elevator doors open. I follow Kris and Louis to an area where the spots are reserved and Kris starts walking toward a beautiful silver Porsche. 

“Wow…” I’ve loved Porsches ever since I was a little girl. My dad enjoys racing, and with his favorite car being Porches, it automatically becamee mine aswell. “My dream car is a 911 Carrera” I say as I walk around the car in awe.

“Well sadly this is just a Turbo” Kris unlocks the car.

“Just a Turbo” Louis mocks and unlocks the car beside it, a black Maserati GranTurismo.

“Your kidding” I can’t help but gawk over that car aswell.

“Now if you’d rather ride with me you could.” Louis smirks at me and then Kris.

“Sorry Louis but this baby always comes first” I chuckle.

“Aww~” Kris puts his hand on his chest.

“She meant the car”

“Uh, I- I know” Kris tries to save himself but fails completely. “Let’s just go” He opens the car door for me like a gentleman, then gets in himself. 

“I’m so tired I feel like I could fall asleep anywhere” Kris says as he starts the car and start to drive. 

“Please don’t?” I hold onto the roof handle, “I want to live”

Kris laughs and starts to speed down the road,  thankfully the roads are totally empty, there’s not a soul for miles. He managed to get me from the studio to my apartment complex in three minutes, probably could’ve gone faster if it weren’t for a red light.

“Wan’t me to escort you up?” Kris says as he stops right outside the doors to my buildning

“I think I’ll manage” I laugh and open the  car door to get out.

“Be at the studio tomorrow at 12, k?”

“Yes sir” 

I close the car door behind me and hear him speed off again as I enter the building. I was longing for my bed which made the elevator ride feel like a million years. So close but yet so far… After an agonizing minute I finally reached my floor. While trying to unlock my front door I notice that it’s unlocked.

“Damn it Jackson” I say quietly to myself. The one thing I asked him to do was to lock the door when he left. This is so unsafe!

I open the door, happy to see that I haven’t been burglurized, and walk in. I take off my shoes and jacket and go straight to the bedroom, ready to just fall onto the bed and sleep. 

To my surprise, I find a grown man on my bed. 

I sigh, I’m exhausted and all I want is to just bury myself in my fluffy duvet, but I can’t help smiling at how peaceful Jackson looks. Not wanting to disturb him I grab a pillow from the bed and occupy the couch instead. Thankfully I’m way too tired to care about it not being the most comfy and slowly but surely drift off into dreamland.

-

“Rise and shine you sloth” 

“Hmpf” I roll over. For a split second I think that I’m about to roll off the couch, but I’m actually met with more soft surface. I open my eyes slowly, annoyed by the light coming through the windows.

“Did you move me to the bed?” I ask Jackson who hands me my black fluffy robe.

“Yea I’m surprised you didn’t wake up, I might have banged your head against the doorframe” 

“Seriously?!” I touch my head to feel for a bumb or bruise.

Jackson laughs. “What do you think?”

I shiver as I feel the cold breeze from the air-con hit my skin and put my robe on. After,  wrapping myself in a nearby blanket.

“Cold?” 

“No kidding…” I press the off button on the air-con controller.

“Lucky for you I made soup” Jackson skips out happily into the kitchen.

As if on queue the smell of chicken soup hits my nose. 

“It’s basically lunch since it’s 1am but you came back so late I thought I’d let you sleep”

“Thanks” I smile and pat his shoulder, grabbing a bowl. “I must say I was surprised to see you sleeping in my bed this morning”

“Sorry…” he said looking flustered, “I had a rough night yesterday so I really didn’t feel like going back to my apartment… Sorry for stealing your bed.”

“It’s ok” Now I feel quilty for questioning him. Obviously I don’t have anything against Jackson Wang sleeping in my apartment, I was just curious as to why. “Is it something you want to talk about?”

“Not really” He said, eyes fixed on his bowl of soup. “I want to but-” He stopped himself from saying more, “Nah forget it.”

“What do you mean you want to?” I couldn’t help myself. 

He sighed, put his spoon down and held his head in his hands. “I want to talk about it but I can’t.” He mumbles , so quiet I can barely hear him.

My phone starts buzzing and the screen shows that Kris is calling. SHIT I was suppose to be at the studio an hour ago! I peek at Jackson who looks as distressed as ever. I can’t just leave him like this?

“Hey Kris…” I answer the phone. I ready myself for a tell-off but I’m stunned when I hear him speak

“Heyy” He answers with a deeper and raspier voice than usual. Damn I’m a real sucker for guys and their morning voices.

“Just woke up too huh?” I say and I can’t help but blush as he speaks.

“Yea… 12 was wishful thinking. How about we grab dinner tonight and go to the studio after?” I hear him yawn.

“Sounds good, text me?”

“Will do”

We hang up and Jackson still has his head down. It’s obvious that the boy needs someone to talk to.

“You can go I’ll be fine…” He says as mumbly and quiet as before.

“Jackson I’m not going until you talk to me.”

“You don’t get it, I can’t” He says a little louder this time.

“Well then atleast eat.” I push his bowl toward him. “Or do I need to feed you?”

He doesn’t respond but with a little grunt he picks his spoon back up and starts to eat.

We sit in silence until he’s finished. The frustrated look on his face doesn’t disappear but as time passes it starts to look more sad. When we’re both done he stands up and takes our bowls to the sink. I however move to the couch where I wrap myself in yet another blanket.

“Are you still cold?” Jackson asks.

“No”

“Why the blankets then?”

“I’m settling into the couch, cause I have a feeling we are going to be here for a while” I say as I pat the space beside me on the couch.

Jackson sighs again. “You’re not going to let this go are you?”.

I shake my head and pat the couch again.

He walks over and plops down beside me. “You have to promise me to not tell anybody.” He looks me dead in the eyes, more serious than I’ve ever seen him before.

“Ok…” I say, now afraid of what’s to come.

“Say that you promise!” 

“I promise”

He takes a deep breath.

“It’s about my girlfriend.”

“Girlfriend?!”

“Why don’t you have people over then?” 

“Cause the small amount of friends I do have are either not in Shanghai, way too busy or both” He says as he starts to dig in, “And I’m trying to hang out with you as much as possible before that happens to you aswell. Now eat”

I don’t really know what to say, so I just stuff my face instead. Halfway through our meal my phone starts to ring, it’s Kris.

“Hey” I pick up.

“Hey, can you come to the studio today? Me and Louis have been brainstorming all week and we think we know how to get your name out there” He says exitedly.

“Umm, wow ok yea totally, you mean today as in now?” I answer looking at Jackson for approval. It feels a little weird to just leave after he basically told me all his friends except me are super busy all the time. 

He smiles warmly and nods, “Go”.

“Yea as soon as possible!” I hear Louis say in the backgroud.

“Ok I’m on my way!” I shove the last bit of food in my mouth and run around gathering my keys, wallet and headphones. I stumble and fall as I put my shoes on and Jackson just laughs at me, still eating in peace.

“Wish me luck! Don’t forget to lock the door when you leave!” I remind Jackson and close the door behind me.

Arriving at the building where the studio is located I see the same receptionist who was a bitch to me and Jess when we were here last. Reluctantly I walk up to the desk, not looking forward to her attitude and definitaly not her ruining a most likely very special day. 

“The 41 floo-” I get interrupted by her and the two other receptionist standing up and bowing. “floor…?”

“Good afternoon miss, the elevator is here in a few seconds” she says politely, her hand gesturing to the elevators as a guard opens the gate.

Her kindness surprises me and all I can respond is a mumbled “T- Thank you” as I move on the the elevators.

Reaching the 41st floor, Kris’ labels offices and studios, I greet the receptionist and walk down the hallway to studio 1, knocking before I enter. Kris and Louis are sitting by the mixing board, their backs facing me, working on some song I’ve never heard before. I guess they didn’t notice me coming in with the loud music playing. I walk up right behind them and watch what they’re doing.

“That’s nice” I say as the music stops.

They both jump off their seats, “What th- You scared the living shit out of me!” Kris says as Louis holds his chest and breathes out.

“I’m sorry but I had to!” I laugh as I replay their terrified faces in my head.

“Anyways…” Kris sits back down, “I’m glad you like it cause it’s for you!” 

“What?”

“Well I thought R&B and jazz would go great with your voice so Louis whipped up some samples.” Kris says as he started to play another song.

The beats are absolutely incredible, super detailed and high quality. The music fills my head and I get the same feeling as the first time I ever sung in this studio. I close my eyes and the humming just escapes me. 

“Record” Kris says quietly as Louis picks his phone up and starts to record.

After 40 seconds or so the sample ends and I snap back to reality.

“I think you just made your first song” Kris chuckles, “That was suprisingly easy… and fast”

Louis just stares at me memerized. “And that just… comes to you? Like naturally?”

“Hmm… It’s more like an urge to let it out. I don’t think about it, I just sing whatever feels good”

Louis nods wide-eyed and turns back to the monitors. “Well we can listen to some more samples and the ones you like we can make into full songs. You write music too?

“Yea” 

“Well damn, then we can get started already tonight, everything we need is in this studio!” Louis claps his hands together in exitement.

“Now for promoting, I have some ideas” Kris says as he pulls me to the large couch on the other side of the room.

“I’m fiming a music video for my new song in two days and I thought maybe you could be in it?”

“Are you serious??” 

“We needed to cast a girl anyways and I thought this would be a great teaser for you. We could keep your identity unknown and have people curious about who you are, then right before we release your song we make sure your face is everywhere so everybody is talking about ‘the mystery girl’ you know?”

“I love that” I say so exited I can’t sit still.

“We’ll also try to get some famous music people in Asia to post your face on their social media” He says as he start to look for something in the pile of papers on the table.

Well I know atleast one person who’d help out with that, I think to myself.

“So these are some concept pictures my director sent me” Kris says as he shows me some printed photos. One picture shows a foggy room lit up with a bunch of purple neon lights on the wall, another a white 1966 mustang convertible on a lavender field, the third picture a pool lit up purple with pink rosepetals and glitter on the surface.

“I’m guessing the theme is purple?” I chuckle, “Are these like photos for inspiration or…”

“No they are all taken from the set” He answers as he shows me even more aesthetic scenery. “These are going to be backgrounds in the video”

I almost choke, and I thought they were photoshopped or taken from Instagram or something.

“Your telling me you’ll be in a lavenderfield in a 1966 mustang” I blink at Kris.

“If you agree you’ll be there too”

“I’m totally down.” I say as I keep looking through the pictures, in awe that some of these places even exist.

Kris and I start talking more in detail about the music video and how they are going to promote me to the world and later all three of us start to work on music. I pick the samples I like the most and as Kris and Louis start to mess around with the beat I write a few test verses.

A few hours pass and we order dinner to eat while we work, same thing when the clock strikes 12 and Louis demands a midnight snack. Time flies by and we’ve somehow managed to lay down the basic structure of three different songs.

“Guys I think it’s time we go home and sleep” Kris yawns.

I look at my phone, 4am… I didn’t really notice how tired I was until Kris started yawning like crazy next to me.

“Yea I could use some sleep…” I yawn back.

“Oh come on guys we just got the flow!” Louis protests, having just as much energy as 12 hours ago. 

“We can continue tomorrow” Kris stands up an grabs his jacket. “(Y/N) you need a ride?”

My apartment is actually a 20 minute walk away, like Kevin said it has a crazy convenient location, but I’m not sure I want to walk 20 minutes alone at 4am in the morning.

“Yes please” I stand up as well to get my things.

Louis throws a little hissyfit about us ruining “the flow” but soon gives up and follow us out and down to the garage. I’m not surprised to see a bunch of fancy and expensive cars when the elevator doors open. I follow Kris and Louis to an area where the spots are reserved and Kris starts walking toward a beautiful silver Porsche. 

“Wow…” I’ve loved Porsches ever since I was a little girl. My dad enjoys racing, and with his favorite car being Porches, it automatically becamee mine aswell. “My dream car is a 911 Carrera” I say as I walk around the car in awe.

“Well sadly this is just a Turbo” Kris unlocks the car.

“Just a Turbo” Louis mocks and unlocks the car beside it, a black Maserati GranTurismo.

“Your kidding” I can’t help but gawk over that car aswell.

“Now if you’d rather ride with me you could.” Louis smirks at me and then Kris.

“Sorry Louis but this baby always comes first” I chuckle.

“Aww~” Kris puts his hand on his chest.

“She meant the car”

“Uh, I- I know” Kris tries to save himself but fails completely. “Let’s just go” He opens the car door for me like a gentleman, then gets in himself. 

“I’m so tired I feel like I could fall asleep anywhere” Kris says as he starts the car and start to drive. 

“Please don’t?” I hold onto the roof handle, “I want to live”

Kris laughs and starts to speed down the road,  thankfully the roads are totally empty, there’s not a soul for miles. He managed to get me from the studio to my apartment complex in three minutes, probably could’ve gone faster if it weren’t for a red light.

“Wan’t me to escort you up?” Kris says as he stops right outside the doors to my buildning

“I think I’ll manage” I laugh and open the  car door to get out.

“Be at the studio tomorrow at 12, k?”

“Yes sir” 

I close the car door behind me and hear him speed off again as I enter the building. I was longing for my bed which made the elevator ride feel like a million years. So close but yet so far… After an agonizing minute I finally reached my floor. While trying to unlock my front door I notice that it’s unlocked.

“Damn it Jackson” I say quietly to myself. The one thing I asked him to do was to lock the door when he left. This is so unsafe!

I open the door, happy to see that I haven’t been burglurized, and walk in. I take off my shoes and jacket and go straight to the bedroom, ready to just fall onto the bed and sleep. 

To my surprise, I find a grown man on my bed. 

I sigh, I’m exhausted and all I want is to just bury myself in my fluffy duvet, but I can’t help smiling at how peaceful Jackson looks. Not wanting to disturb him I grab a pillow from the bed and occupy the couch instead. Thankfully I’m way too tired to care about it not being the most comfy and slowly but surely drift off into dreamland.

-

“Rise and shine you sloth” 

“Hmpf” I roll over. For a split second I think that I’m about to roll off the couch, but I’m actually met with more soft surface. I open my eyes slowly, annoyed by the light coming through the windows.

“Did you move me to the bed?” I ask Jackson who hands me my black fluffy robe.

“Yea I’m surprised you didn’t wake up, I might have banged your head against the doorframe” 

“Seriously?!” I touch my head to feel for a bumb or bruise.

Jackson laughs. “What do you think?”

I shiver as I feel the cold breeze from the air-con hit my skin and put my robe on. After,  wrapping myself in a nearby blanket.

“Cold?” 

“No kidding…” I press the off button on the air-con controller.

“Lucky for you I made soup” Jackson skips out happily into the kitchen.

As if on queue the smell of chicken soup hits my nose. 

“It’s basically lunch since it’s 1am but you came back so late I thought I’d let you sleep”

“Thanks” I smile and pat his shoulder, grabbing a bowl. “I must say I was surprised to see you sleeping in my bed this morning”

“Sorry…” he said looking flustered, “I had a rough night yesterday so I really didn’t feel like going back to my apartment… Sorry for stealing your bed.”

“It’s ok” Now I feel quilty for questioning him. Obviously I don’t have anything against Jackson Wang sleeping in my apartment, I was just curious as to why. “Is it something you want to talk about?”

“Not really” He said, eyes fixed on his bowl of soup. “I want to but-” He stopped himself from saying more, “Nah forget it.”

“What do you mean you want to?” I couldn’t help myself. 

He sighed, put his spoon down and held his head in his hands. “I want to talk about it but I can’t.” He mumbles , so quiet I can barely hear him.

My phone starts buzzing and the screen shows that Kris is calling. SHIT I was suppose to be at the studio an hour ago! I peek at Jackson who looks as distressed as ever. I can’t just leave him like this?

“Hey Kris…” I answer the phone. I ready myself for a tell-off but I’m stunned when I hear him speak

“Heyy” He answers with a deeper and raspier voice than usual. Damn I’m a real sucker for guys and their morning voices.

“Just woke up too huh?” I say and I can’t help but blush as he speaks.

“Yea… 12 was wishful thinking. How about we grab dinner tonight and go to the studio after?” I hear him yawn.

“Sounds good, text me?”

“Will do”

We hang up and Jackson still has his head down. It’s obvious that the boy needs someone to talk to.

“You can go I’ll be fine…” He says as mumbly and quiet as before.

“Jackson I’m not going until you talk to me.”

“You don’t get it, I can’t” He says a little louder this time.

“Well then atleast eat.” I push his bowl toward him. “Or do I need to feed you?”

He doesn’t respond but with a little grunt he picks his spoon back up and starts to eat.

We sit in silence until he’s finished. The frustrated look on his face doesn’t disappear but as time passes it starts to look more sad. When we’re both done he stands up and takes our bowls to the sink. I however move to the couch where I wrap myself in yet another blanket.

“Are you still cold?” Jackson asks.

“No”

“Why the blankets then?”

“I’m settling into the couch, cause I have a feeling we are going to be here for a while” I say as I pat the space beside me on the couch.

Jackson sighs again. “You’re not going to let this go are you?”.

I shake my head and pat the couch again.

He walks over and plops down beside me. “You have to promise me to not tell anybody.” He looks me dead in the eyes, more serious than I’ve ever seen him before.

“Ok…” I say, now afraid of what’s to come.

“Say that you promise!” 

“I promise”

He takes a deep breath.

“It’s about my girlfriend.”

“Girlfriend?!”

body:
Guys!

This is a rant, and like you don’t have to read my rant. I just want to get it out to the world.

Ok? Ok!

Y’all, kpop is not fair. Support your under rated groups!

If a group isn’t debuting from a bigger company; SM, JYP, YG and some others probably. Then they have to pay the company. They pay out of their own paychecks for choreographers, makeup artists, stylists, MV filming, music production, Food and their Dorm, basically anything you can think of. And they end up owing the company money, because they’ve gone into debt.

They only start getting paid once they break even, so when they become super popular.

For example BTS, they’re from a small company so when they started out they weren’t making any money what so ever.

But because they’ve gotten such a massive following they’ve obviously broke even and are getting paid now.

It’s not a fair system, and some groups that never break even are stuck paying their company even after they’ve disbanded.

So please, I beg of you, support underrated groups!

They depend on you.

And if you don’t stan any, ask me for some and I’ll give you like 20! They make good music too, just some people haven’t found them yet.

Please please just give some a chance!!!!!!!!!!

Also, watch the whole thing!!!!!!
